questions.question: A 0.60 kg basketball is thrown horizontally against a wall at 15.0 m/s. It rebounds in the opposite direction at 12.0 m/s. Calculate the total impulse delivered by the wall to the ball.
questions.explanation: $p_i = 9.0$ kg·m/s toward, $p_f = -7.2$ kg·m/s away. $\Delta p = -16.2$ N·s (away from wall).

questions.question: A 1,600 kg car traveling at 18.0 m/s hits a safety barrier and comes to a complete stop in 0.45 seconds. Determine the average net force acting on the car during the collision.
A 2.5 kg object is moving East. An impulse of 40.0 N·s is applied in the West direction, resulting in a final velocity of 6.0 m/s West. What was the object's initial velocity?
A 0.40 kg soccer ball is traveling South at 10.0 m/s. A player kicks it, and its new velocity is 15.0 m/s East. Calculate the magnitude of the impulse imparted to the ball.
questions.explanation: $p_i = 4.0$ kg·m/s South, $p_f = 6.0$ kg·m/s East. Impulse $= \sqrt{6^2 + 4^2} = \sqrt{52} = 7.21$ N·s.

questions.question: A jet engine provides a reverse thrust of 25,000 N to slow down a 12,000 kg aircraft from 60.0 m/s to 20.0 m/s. Calculate the time duration the engines must provide this thrust.
What principle is the impulse-momentum theorem derived from?
questions.explanation: $F = dp/dt$ is Newton's Second Law. Integrating gives impulse-momentum theorem.

questions.question: How does reducing the contact time during a collision affect the average force experienced?
options: It keeps the average force the same.
It has no effect on force.
questions.explanation: $F_{avg} = \Delta p/\Delta t$. Smaller time gives larger force.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of applying the impulse-momentum theorem in a 2D context?
options: A ball rolling down a hill
A basketball bouncing off the ground
A car accelerating on a straight road
questions.explanation: Basketball bouncing changes direction, requiring 2D vector analysis.

questions.question: If an object experiences a net force of zero, what can be said about its momentum?
A 1.2 kg hammer hits a nail at a speed of 8.0 m/s and comes to rest in 0.005 seconds. Calculate the average force exerted on the nail.
